title: Phenomenological Interpretation and Practical Strategies for Online Language Education in the Pandemic Era: Expression, Reading, and Interaction-Centered Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency (reading, writing, speaking, listening), foundational skills in using digital learning tools, and a basic understanding of grammatical structures
context.additional_context: Subjective experience analysis and practical strategy development to improve the effectiveness of online language education amid ongoing post-pandemic uncertainty. Particularly emphasizes expressive skill enhancement and text-based interaction optimization in asynchronous environments.

learning_goals: Learners can design at least three self-directed language learning strategies (vocabulary expansion, text analysis, expression practice) for online environments.

Learners phenomenologically analyze power dynamics and decision-making structures in online classes during the pandemic and explain how learner interaction patterns correlate with language learning effectiveness.

Learners can explain procedures to validate assessment validity (grammar/vocabulary accuracy) and fairness (feedback consistency) when designing formative assessments using digital tools (Quizlet, Google Forms, etc.).

To maintain work-life balance in online learning environments, learners implement a weekly study/rest plan at over 80% adherence and execute three personalized strategies (e.g., splitting study sessions, feedback routines, setting reading comprehension focus time) using time management tools (Notion, Google Calendar, etc.).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
